text: Huyghe or Huyghé may refer to: * Huyghe Brewery (Brouwerij Huyghe) is a brewery founded in 1906 in Belgium by Leon Huyghe in city of Melle in East Flanders. == People == * Armand Huyghé was a Belgian World War I General * Gérard-Maurice Eugène Huyghe was a 20th-century French Catholic Bishop. * Pierre Huyghe (born 1962) is a French artist who works in a variety of media. * René Huyghe was a French writer on the history, psychology and philosophy of art. * Sébastien Huyghe (born 1969) is a member of the National Assembly of France. ==See also== Armand Huyghé, Belgian colonel
title: Huyghe
